duties_responsibilities.duty: Construct, build, repair, and inspect Hybrid Fiber Coax (HFC) networks for voice, video, and data services.
Coordinate with other utilities for permits, joint trench, pole applications, and service issues.
Conduct aerial hardware construction and installation including strand placement, tensioning, grounding, bonding, guy and anchor installation.
Lay conduit and install joint trenches for underground cable, coordinating with other utilities.
Respond to and determine proper course of action in emergency call-in situations to repair damaged cable lines.
Participate in the construction and/or repair of fiber, coax, and copper plant for networks.
Coordinate and inspect work done by contract labor and ensure work meets company and government regulations.

Use computerized tools and programs (Oracle) to coordinate bill of materials, purchase materials, maintain inventory levels, reconcile invoices, street release forms, zone changes, and computerized mapping systems.
Splice, repair, and activate fiber optic circuits, assist with the maintenance of fiber transport system, nodes, and reverse laser transmitters and receivers.
Ensure that work is performed in a timely and professional manner and meets all regulations, specifications, and standards set forth by the company and government agencies.

Obtain construction permits, utility permits, pole applications, including make-ready, right-of-way, railroad, road bore, and crossing permits. Create and file traffic plans for construction projects.

education_certification.credential: Associate's degree in Telecommunications, Construction Management, or related field (Bachelor's preferred)
